bibl.title: Letter from Juan Guiteras to Wickliffe Rose, January 17, 1923

div1.p: Guiteras explains that he must resign from the International Health Board's Yellow Fever Council because he is going into general practice, and will not have enough time.

div1.head: Letter from Juan Guiteras to Wickliffe Rose, January 17, 1923
div1.p:
Perhaps I should have explained the reason of my resig-
nation, as I interpret your letter acknowledging receipt of the same.

I have to go into general practice here, in the country,
where I am residing. I have to study my cases, and cannot keep up
my reading and study of the general situation as to yellow fever.
I believe, therefore, that my services cannot be useful in this matter.
